info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 12:43PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A moderate band of snow will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark, southwestern Chouteau and central Cascade Counties through 115 PM MST... At 1240 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking moderate snow showers along a line extending from 16 miles south of The Knees to 10 miles east of Fort Shaw to 18 miles south of Augusta. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Brief period of moderate snow and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Variable visibility down to a half mile or less and slippery roads could result in hazardous driving conditions. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Cascade, Belt, Black Eagle, Wolf Creek, Highwood, Carter, Floweree, Portage, Eden, Malmstrom Afb, Stockett, Tracy, Vaughn, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Centerville, Tower Rock State Park, Shonkin, Craig and Armington. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 225 and 291. Highway 200 between mile markers 83 and 106. Highway 287 between mile markers 1 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
